## Natural history notes

The scrubland goldenaster (Chrysopsis subulata) is a native wildflower endemic to the central Florida peninsula. It is less common south of Lake Okeechobee and north of Gainesville, and it has not been yet found anywhere in the Florida panhandle. It can be found in habitats such as scrubby flatwoods or longleaf pine flatwoods.
